questions.question: Which of the following is not considered a big cat?

"Call me Ishmael."
"I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape."
"I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship."
"In spite of everything I still believe that people are really good at heart"
"It was a pleasure to burn."
"The sky above the port was the color of television, tuned to a dead channel."
"You don't know about me without you have read a book by the name of 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer'; but that ain't no matter. That book was made by a Mr Mark Twain, and he told the truth, mainly."
"All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others."
"All grown-ups were once children - but only few of them remember it."
"Anything worth dying for is certainly worth living for."
"Don't ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody."

"I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin but you begin anyway and you see it through no matter what."
"I was benevolent and good; misery made me a fiend. Make me happy, and I shall again be virtuous."
"It is to the credit of human nature that, except where its selfishness is brought into play, it loves more readily than it hates."
"Most people were heartless about turtles because a turtle's heart will beat for hours after it has been cut up and butchered. But the old man thought, I have such a heart too."
answers: The Old Man and the Sea

Abstract
answers: a concept or idea not associated with any specific instance

questions.question: Advocate
answers: a person who pleads for a cause or propounds an idea

questions.question: Belittle
answers: lessen the authority, dignity, or reputation of

questions.question: Censure
Comply
answers: act in accordance with someone's rules, commands, or wishes

questions.question: Deference
answers: a disposition or tendency to yield to the will of others

questions.question: Eccentric
answers: a person of a specified kind (usually with many eccentricities)

questions.question: Facilitate
Guile
answers: shrewdness as demonstrated by being skilled in deception

questions.question: Heed
answers: paying particular notice (as to children or helpless people)

questions.question: Inadvertent
answers: without intention (especially resulting from heedless action)

questions.question: Mar
answers: a mark or flaw that spoils the appearance of something (especially on a person's body)

questions.question: Parsimony
Recalcitrant
answers: marked by stubborn resistance to authority

questions.question: Tangible
answers: possible to be treated as fact

questions.question: Verbose
answers: using or containing too many words

questions.question: Adjunct
answers: something attached to but holding an inferior position

questions.question: Congregate
answers: To come together in a group, assemble.

questions.question: Dialogue
Eloquent
Gregarious
answers: seeking and enjoying the company of others

questions.question: Injunction
Junction
answers: an act of joining or adjoining things

questions.question: Juncture
answers: a joining together; the point at which two things are joined; any important point in time

questions.question: Malady
Malcontent
answers: person dissatisfied with existing state of affairs

questions.question: Malevolent
answers: wishing or appearing to wish evil to others

questions.question: Malicious
answers: wishing evil or harm upon others

questions.question: Phonetic
answers: related to the sounds in a language

questions.question: Segregate
Soliloquy
answers: the act of talking to oneself or a dramatic monologue

questions.question: Allegory
answers: a representation of an abstract or spiritual meaning through concrete or material forms

questions.question: Ambiguity
answers: doubtfulness or uncertainty of meaning or intention

questions.question: Anecdote
answers: a short account of a particular incident or event of an interesting or amusing nature, often biographical.

questions.question: Annotated
answers: supplied with or containing explanatory notes and textual comments

questions.question: Assuage
Auspicious
Buoyancy
answers: the power to float or rise in a fluid, the upward pressure exerted by the fluid in which a body is immersed

questions.question: Conceit
answers: an excessively favorable opinion of one's own ability, importance or wit

questions.question: Conspicuous
Denotation
answers: a word that names or signifies something specific

questions.question: Discern
Enigma
Euphemism
answers: the substitution of a mild, indirect, or vague expression for one thought to be offensive, harsh, or blunt

questions.question: Principle
answers: a fundamental, primary, or general law or truth from which others are derived

questions.question: Procure
Quandary
answers: a state of perplexity or uncertainty

questions.question: Antithesis
answers: the direct opposite or contrast to a previously given assertion

questions.question: Benevolent
answers: showing or motivated by sympathy and understanding and generosity

questions.question: Brazen
Chicanery
Conundrum
Deleterious
Enervate
answers: to weaken, or to take energy from

questions.question: Evanescent
Fortuitous
Guru
Hegemony
answers: one country/group has leadership over another

questions.question: Impetuous
answers: characterized by undue haste and lack of thought or deliberation

questions.question: Jovial
Loquacious
Peruse
Sensuous
answers: all senses, dealing w/ all senses
